intro: Hieracium helsingicum, commonly known as Helsingian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to northern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. It produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom from June to August, and its leaves are lance-shaped with a rough texture. Hieracium helsingicum is a herbaceous perennial that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters.
